name: The Magellan Sutera Resort
detail: the location of magellan sutera is very good,only 3mins drive to the city centre and easy to look for local food. the room is classic,clean and the swimming pool is also an attraction of the hotel. the most amazing part is the breakfast,there're so many choices of food and drinks (including italy coffee) for us. well,the service,environment,cleaniness,facilities,food and drinks are all above my expectation. it could be considered as the best 5-star hotel in kota kinabalu.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: The Pacific Sutera Hotel
detail: The Pacific Sutera (silk) is probably the best Resort hotel in Kota Kinabalu. What they dont tell you in the website is that you can also enjoy the pool areas of the MAGELLAN And their members only marina (great for the kids!). THe Marina is the only pool area that has the slides, so if you plan to stay here at the PAcific, walk around the boardwalk - its good excercise and make the huge complex a bit closer to each other.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: Citadines Waterfront Kota Kinabalu
detail: First time in this hotel and one of the best ive ever booked
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: Promenade Hotel Kota Kinabalu
detail: Very good value for money. Clean, good facilities and fit out is modern and functional. Would recommend to anyone as either business or holiday hotel. Facilities are just as good as some of the more expensive 'Brand' hotels in Kota Kinabalu but at a significantly lower cost.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: Tune Hotel â€“ 1Borneo Kota Kinabalu
detail: My stay at Tune Hotel 1Borneo Kota Kinabalu is very positive. This is my second visit to the same hotel after a couple of years. But this is my first stay through Agoda.com and I find the service from both the online booking to actual staying very good. Room is small but equipped with all the essentials. I am glad that I had the air-conditioning as it is a bit tough without it. But still, it is reasonable in pricing. I was here for a seminar and having the hotel located right in the shopping mall itself made it feel integrated and easy to find things that I need.

name: Ming Garden Hotel and Residences
detail: The room was cleaned and the staff was friendly and helpful.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: TOOJOU Kota Kinabalu
detail: Great location. Itâ€™s 5 minutes walk to the minibus and taxi station that go to the nearby towns. Walking distance to the main street. Lots of cheap eats around and 7-11 is one block away. Service is great and the hotel staff are very cheerful and helpful. Thereâ€™s even a slide in the hostel. Highly recommended.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: Horizon Hotel Kota Kinabalu
detail: the horizon hotel in kota kinabalu is situated in the heart of the city close the istanza, the sabah governorâ€™s residence. itâ€™s a new hotel, being only 4 months old. but donâ€™t let that dissuade you from staying here. the general manager, philip d. theseira, who i would now count as a good friend, has a top rate staff. all are very welcoming, polite and most helpful; addressing you by name as to go about your business. they even moved me to a new room, because i couldnâ€™t establish an internet connection in my original room. rooms are spacious having king sized beds, a small area for sitting and relaxing, and large walk in showers. larger rooms are also available for those with children. but the room size i had was perfect for the duration of my stay. the hotel has three levels of secure private parking, which is free to hotel guests. in addition there is a swimming pool and well equipped gymnasium on the sixth floor, allowing for mostly uninterrupted views out across the bay. these are used at the guestâ€™s own risk, as there are no staff or life guards present. the two excellent restaurants, give the guest a choice of food styles from around the region, as well as international cuisine. however please be aware that all food is halal, so there is no pork available on the menus. with its situation in the centre of the city; itâ€™s only a short walk to all the shopping malls, restaurants and bars. i never had to use a taxi once, preferring to walk around and see all that was on offer. itâ€™s also ideally located to all the scuba dive centres that offer very reasonably priced diving off the islands of gaya and sapi. iâ€™ve already planned my next stay, if for nothing else, but the convenience. but thatâ€™s not the only reason of course.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: Le MÃ©ridien Kota Kinabalu
detail: Really nice luxury hotel in walking distance to near the waterfront and nightlife. Level 14 has a nearly opened rooftop sky bar which would be probably the best location in Kota Kinabalu. There is also a special private club lounge on level 14 which is worth the daily upgrade if you take advantage of the amazing breakfast, lunch and dinner buffers and drinks. The hotel feels brand new and there was lots to see and explore within the complex. The pool on Level 2 is great relief to avoid the day time heat. The daily night market and other markets are very close by which are worth visiting to see more of the real Kota Kinabalu culture. We highly recommend this hotel for couples, groups and for business conferences. We attended a Wedding dinner on Level 3 and the service and atmosphere were excellent.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map

name: Sunset Seaview Vacation Condos @ Jesselton Quay
detail: We really enjoyed our stay and would love to come again.
area: Central Business District,Kota Kinabalu - View on map
